And, entering the city with a ruse, he ruled Damascus.although the citizens did not want this out of fear for their sons, whom they had sent as hostages to Jerusalem out of submission to the will of the king.For at the beginning of 603 of the era, the son of Zengi, the lord of Aleppo, came and wished to rule Damascus as fraudulently.they also began to make plans for the city of Damascus.Then after this great and wondrous victory, stopping a while to rest,indeed for us, to the pride and joy of the faithful.They erected the redeeming cross on all the tall buildings for the shame and humiliation of all the degenerate, dark, and wicked nations.And instead of un-Christian voices the voice of the life-giving Gospel could be heard in all places.And he removed the others, making them live outside the city.until the philanthropic king fed a countless number of them to the sword, those filled with the blood of the Christians.After this, finding treachery from the infidel race of the Scyths,And the city was given into the hands of the king and the Brothers on the day of the Assumption of the Holy Virgin by her intercession.Then after these tribulations, the intercessor and hope of the Christians, the Mother of God, prayed to our Lord Jesus Christ that he finally bring [them] victory on account of their patience in suffering.And several of them became worthy of the martyr's crown, as well as no small number of the Brothers.together with the good and holy king, for a year.for which the noble Frankish race patiently endured many difficulties,for which the noble Frankish race patiently endured many difficulties, to rule over the impregnable, inaccessible, and un-Christian town of Askalon,the son of Kontanj [Fulk of Anjou] king of the Franks. Taking him in hand, the great God gave him a great victory:We come back to what we forgot: in 602 of the Armenian era a king of 18 years sat in Jerusalem.
